info.title: Predexon API
info.description: Prediction market data aggregation and matching API

get.description:
Find matching markets across Polymarket and Kalshi platforms.

Provide exactly ONE of:
- polymarket_condition_id
- polymarket_market_slug
- polymarket_market_id
- kalshi_market_ticker

Returns:
- Exact matches: Markets representing the same event
- Related matches: Markets for correlated events

parameters.name: match_type

schema.description: Filter by match type: 'exact', 'related', or 'all' (default: all)
schema.title: Match Type

parameters.description: Filter by match type: 'exact', 'related', or 'all' (default: all)

schema.title: Response Get Matching Markets V1 Matching Markets Get

get.description:
Find matching markets for multiple market identifiers at once.

Provide exactly ONE of:
- polymarket_condition_ids
- polymarket_market_slugs
- polymarket_market_ids
- kalshi_market_tickers

Returns a dictionary mapping each input identifier to its matches.

parameters.name: match_type

schema.description: Filter by match type: 'exact', 'related', or 'all' (default: all)
schema.title: Match Type

parameters.description: Filter by match type: 'exact', 'related', or 'all' (default: all)

get.description:
Get all exact market pairs across Polymarket and Kalshi.

Returns exact match pairs with real-time price data and arbitrage calculations.
Results are ordered by similarity score (highest first) and paginated.

Includes pricing data: yes/no bid/ask prices, spreads, and arbitrage opportunities.

parameters.name: active_only

schema.description: Only return pairs where both markets are active
schema.title: Active Only

parameters.description: Only return pairs where both markets are active

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Maximum number of pairs to return
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: Maximum number of pairs to return

get.description:
Fetch realized profit and loss (PnL) for a specific wallet address.

Returns realized gains only - from confirmed sells or redeems.
Uses user_pnl_daily for historical data and user_pnl_summary for live data.

When condition_id is provided, returns realized PnL for that specific market only.
This handles split/merge operations correctly by aggregating both sides.

parameters.name: wallet

schema.description: Wallet address to fetch PnL for
schema.title: Wallet

parameters.description: Wallet address to fetch PnL for

parameters.name: start_time

schema.description: Unix timestamp (seconds) for start of range
schema.title: Start Time

parameters.description: Unix timestamp (seconds) for start of range

parameters.name: end_time

schema.description: Unix timestamp (seconds) for end of range
schema.title: End Time

parameters.description: Unix timestamp (seconds) for end of range

parameters.name: condition_id

schema.description: Filter to a specific market by condition ID
schema.title: Condition Id

parameters.description: Filter to a specific market by condition ID

get.description:
Fetch current positions for a wallet address.

Returns all open positions with cost basis, current market prices, and P&L calculations.
Uses real-time PostgreSQL data for positions.
Supports filtering by market_slug or condition_id.

schema.description: Wallet address to fetch positions for
schema.title: Wallet

schema.description: Minimum number of shares to include

schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: Maximum number of positions to return (1-200)

get.description:
Fetch historical candlestick data for a market.

Returns combined OHLCV data from both YES and NO tokens, normalized to YES perspective.
NO token prices are converted as (1 - price) and volumes are combined.

parameters.name: start_time

schema.description: Unix timestamp (seconds) for start of time range
schema.title: Start Time

parameters.description: Unix timestamp (seconds) for start of time range

parameters.name: end_time

schema.description: Unix timestamp (seconds) for end of time range
schema.title: End Time

parameters.description: Unix timestamp (seconds) for end of time range

get.description:
Fetch the current or historical market price for a token.

Uses last 5 trades across both tokens (Yes/No) of the market:
- If all prices within $0.10: weighted average by USD amount
- Otherwise: last traded price

Fetch activity data for a specific user.

Uses the MV-populated activity_unified_table for optimal single-table query performance.

List markets with filtering and sorting from PostgreSQL database.

Consolidates active and closed markets into a single endpoint.
Use status=open for active markets only.

Rolling metrics (volume_1d/7d/30d, trades, OI) are sourced from
the market_metrics_summary table, refreshed hourly by the indexer cron.

parameters.name: status

schema.description: Filter by status: open or closed
schema.title: Status

parameters.description: Filter by status: open or closed

get.description: Return historical time series of traded volume for a token (day+ granularity).

get.summary: Get Market Open Interest Time Series
get.description: Provide historical open interest (total value of tokens circulating from split, merge, redeem, and conversion events) with min granularity day.

Fetch historical orderbook snapshots for a specific asset (token ID) over a specified time range.

Returns snapshots of the order book including bids, asks, and market metadata in order.
All timestamps are in milliseconds. Orderbook data has history starting from January 1st, 2026.

schema.description: The token ID (asset) for the Polymarket market

get.description:
Fetch historical trade data.

Returns trades from Polymarket with support for:
- Filtering by market_slug, condition_id, token_id, or user
- Time range filtering
- Cursor-based pagination

At least one of market_slug, condition_id, token_id, or user must be provided.

Fetch volume chart data for a market, broken down by YES/NO side.

Returns per-period total, YES, and NO volume aggregated from trade events.

parameters.name: granularity

schema.description: Time granularity: hour, day, or week

parameters.description: Time granularity: hour, day, or week

get.description:
Get complete smart wallet profile.

Returns all metrics across all time windows and style classifications.
Uses PostgreSQL for all_time (real-time) and ClickHouse for rolling windows.

Get global leaderboard of smart wallets.

Supports filtering by trading styles and numeric thresholds.
Uses ClickHouse rolling tables for all time windows.

parameters.name: min_avg_trade_usd

schema.description: Minimum avg trade size in USD
schema.title: Min Avg Trade Usd

parameters.description: Minimum avg trade size in USD

get.description:
Get leaderboard for a specific market.

Shows wallet rankings for trading performance within a single market.
Uses ClickHouse user_market_metrics_rolling for all time windows.

Get per-market breakdown for a wallet.

Shows performance metrics for each market the wallet has traded in.
Uses ClickHouse rolling tables for all time windows.

Filter wallets by market trades with AND/OR logic, with metric filters on combined performance.

**Use Cases:**
- Find all wallets that traded Market A AND Market B AND Market C (intersection)
- Find all wallets that traded Market A OR Market B OR Market C (union)
- Filter by combined performance: wallets with combined win_rate > 50% across these markets

**Query Logic:**
- AND: Returns wallets that have traded ALL specified markets
- OR: Returns wallets that have traded ANY of the specified markets

**Metrics:**
All metrics (pnl, volume, win_rate, roi, profit_factor) are aggregated across the
specified markets only. Derived metrics (win_rate, ROI, profit_factor) are properly
calculated from underlying sums, not averaged.

Uses ClickHouse for fast aggregation across markets.

parameters.name: market_logic

schema.description: AND = traded ALL markets, OR = traded ANY market

parameters.description: AND = traded ALL markets, OR = traded ANY market

parameters.name: min_pnl

schema.description: Minimum combined PnL across specified markets (USD)
schema.title: Min Pnl

parameters.description: Minimum combined PnL across specified markets (USD)

parameters.name: max_pnl

schema.description: Maximum combined PnL across specified markets (USD)
schema.title: Max Pnl

parameters.description: Maximum combined PnL across specified markets (USD)

parameters.name: min_volume

schema.description: Minimum combined volume across specified markets (USD)
schema.title: Min Volume

parameters.description: Minimum combined volume across specified markets (USD)

parameters.name: min_trades

schema.description: Minimum combined trade count across specified markets
schema.title: Min Trades

parameters.description: Minimum combined trade count across specified markets

parameters.name: min_roi

schema.description: Minimum combined ROI across specified markets (decimal)
schema.title: Min Roi

parameters.description: Minimum combined ROI across specified markets (decimal)

get.description:
Discover markets where high-performing wallets are active.

**Use Case:** Find alpha by seeing where profitable traders are putting their money.

**How it works:**
1. Define "smart wallets" using the filter criteria (min_pnl, min_roi, etc.)
2. Find all markets these wallets have traded
3. Rank markets by smart wallet activity (volume, count, PnL)

Returns markets sorted by smart wallet activity metrics.

Get smart money positioning for a specific market.

**Use Case:** See what profitable traders are doing on a specific market.

**Returns:**
- How many smart wallets are net buyers vs net sellers
- Average entry prices for smart wallets
- Total volume and PnL from smart wallets

Find wallets with similar market portfolios (copy-trade detection).

**Use Case:**
- Find wallets that trade similar markets to a target wallet
- Detect potential copy-trading patterns
- Discover traders with similar strategies

**How it works:**
1. Get all markets the target wallet has traded
2. Find other wallets that traded the same markets
3. Rank by overlap percentage and count

parameters.name: min_overlap_pct

schema.description: Minimum overlap percentage (0-1). E.g., 0.5 = at least 50% market overlap
schema.title: Min Overlap Pct

parameters.description: Minimum overlap percentage (0-1). E.g., 0.5 = at least 50% market overlap

get.description:
Compare performance across trading style cohorts.

**Use Case:** Understand which trading styles perform best.

**Cohorts:** Based on primary_trading_style classification:
- WHALE: Large position traders
- MARKET_MAKER: Balanced buy/sell with frequent trading
- ACTIVE_TRADER: High trade frequency
- BUY_AND_HOLD: Long holding periods
- DEGEN: High-risk patterns
- HIGH_CONVICTION: Buys at high prices
- CONTRARIAN: Takes unpopular sides
- VALUE_HUNTER: Enters at uncertain odds

Returns aggregate statistics for each cohort.

parameters.name: min_trades

schema.description: Minimum trades to be included in cohort (filters noise)
schema.title: Min Trades

parameters.description: Minimum trades to be included in cohort (filters noise)

get.description:
List crypto up/down prediction markets.

Returns Bitcoin, Ethereum, Solana, and XRP up/down markets across
all timeframes (15m, 1h, 4h, daily). Supports filtering by asset,
timeframe, status, and time range.

**Common queries:**
- Current open markets: `?status=open`
- BTC 15m timeline: `?asset=btc&timeframe=15m&sort=asc`
- Recent BTC 15m results: `?asset=btc&timeframe=15m&status=closed&limit=20`
- Time window: `?end_after=<unix_ts>&end_before=<unix_ts>&sort=asc`

parameters.name: asset

schema.description: Filter by crypto asset: btc, eth, sol, xrp
schema.title: Asset

parameters.description: Filter by crypto asset: btc, eth, sol, xrp

parameters.name: status

schema.description: Filter by market status: open, closed
schema.title: Status

parameters.description: Filter by market status: open, closed

parameters.name: end_after

schema.description: Only markets with end_time after this Unix timestamp
schema.title: End After

parameters.description: Only markets with end_time after this Unix timestamp

parameters.name: end_before

schema.description: Only markets with end_time before or at this Unix timestamp
schema.title: End Before

parameters.description: Only markets with end_time before or at this Unix timestamp

parameters.name: sort

schema.description: Sort by end_time: desc (most recent first) or asc (chronological)

parameters.description: Sort by end_time: desc (most recent first) or asc (chronological)

get.description:
List events with filtering and sorting from PostgreSQL database.

Events are top-level groupings that contain one or more markets.
Use status=open for active events only.

parameters.name: status

schema.description: Filter by status: open or closed
schema.title: Status

get.description:
List Kalshi markets with filtering and sorting.

Returns markets from the Kalshi prediction market platform with support for:
- Status filtering (open, closed)
- Price range filtering (0-100 scale)
- Volume and open interest thresholds
- Text search in titles
- Filtering by ticker, event ticker, or series ticker
- Multiple sort options
- Cursor-based pagination via pagination_key

Prices are returned as decimals (0-1) for API consistency.

parameters.name: status

schema.description: Filter by status: open or closed
schema.title: Status

parameters.description: Filter by status: open or closed

parameters.name: pagination_key

schema.description: Cursor for next page (from previous response)
schema.title: Pagination Key

parameters.description: Cursor for next page (from previous response)

get.description:
Fetch historical Kalshi trade data.

Returns trades from the Kalshi prediction market with support for:
- Filtering by ticker (exact match) or event_ticker (prefix match)
- Time range filtering
- Taker side filtering (yes/no)
- Minimum contract count filtering
- Cursor-based pagination

At least one of `ticker` or `event_ticker` must be provided.

parameters.name: taker_side

schema.description: Filter by taker side: yes or no
schema.title: Taker Side

parameters.description: Filter by taker side: yes or no

get.description:
Fetch historical orderbook snapshots for a Kalshi market over a specified time range.

Returns snapshots of the order book including yes bids, yes asks, and market metadata.
All timestamps are in milliseconds. Prices are in cents (1-99 representing $0.01 to $0.99).

schema.description: Maximum number of snapshots to return

get.description:
Fetch trade history for a wallet on Dflow.

Returns trades from the Dflow platform with support for:
- Filtering by market_ticker, outcome_mint, or trade_type
- Time range filtering
- Cursor-based pagination (efficient for deep pagination)
- Enriched with market metadata (title, category, side)

get.description:
Fetch current positions for a wallet address on Dflow.

Returns all positions with total cost basis, realized PnL, and fees paid.

- **Open positions**: Currently holding tokens (total_qty_bought > total_qty_sold)
- **Closed positions**: No longer holding but has trading history

Enriched with market metadata (title, subtitles) from PostgreSQL.
Uses cursor-based pagination for efficient deep pagination.

parameters.name: status

schema.description: Filter by position status: open, closed, or all (default)
schema.title: Status

parameters.description: Filter by position status: open, closed, or all (default)

schema.description: Filter by specific outcome mint address
schema.title: Outcome Mint

parameters.description: Filter by specific outcome mint address

schema.description: Sort by: total_qty_bought, total_cost_basis, or realized_pnl

parameters.description: Sort by: total_qty_bought, total_cost_basis, or realized_pnl

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Maximum number of positions to return (1-200)
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: Maximum number of positions to return (1-200)

get.description:
Fetch raw book ticker data at microsecond granularity.

Returns bid/ask/mid/spread for each tick. Use cursor-based pagination
to iterate through large time ranges (e.g. a 15m window is ~63K ticks).

Fetch OHLCV candlestick data for a Binance trading pair.

Candle prices are derived from book ticker mid-prices (not trade prices).
Intervals 1s and 1m read from pre-aggregated materialized views.
Larger intervals (5m, 15m, 1h, 4h, 1d) are aggregated on-the-fly from 1m candles.

**Backtesting crypto up/down markets:**
- Use `interval=15m` for 15-minute prediction markets
- Use `interval=1h` for 1-hour prediction markets
- Use `interval=4h` and `interval=1d` for longer timeframes
Root endpoint with API information.
Health check endpoint for Cloud Run.

shares.description: Raw number of shares from blockchain

total_positions.description: Total token positions ever opened (YES and NO counted separately)

BatchMatchingResponse.title: BatchMatchingResponse
BatchMatchingResponse.description:
Response for batch market matching endpoint.

Keys are the input identifiers (condition IDs, slugs, market IDs, or tickers).
Values are match results (PolymarketMatchResponse or KalshiMatchResponse shape)
or error dicts when an individual lookup fails.

tick_count.title: Tick Count
tick_count.description: Number of book ticker updates in this candle

avg_spread.title: Avg Spread
avg_spread.description: Average bid-ask spread over this candle

BinanceCandleData.title: BinanceCandleData
BinanceCandleData.description:
Single OHLCV candlestick derived from book ticker mid-prices.

Open/high/low/close reflect the mid-price (not trade price).
tick_count indicates market activity density within the candle.

candles.title: Candles
candles.description: Array of candles, ordered by timestamp ASC

BinanceCandlesResponse.title: BinanceCandlesResponse
BinanceCandlesResponse.description:
OHLCV candlestick response for a Binance trading pair.

Intervals 1s and 1m are served from pre-aggregated materialized views.
Larger intervals (5m, 15m, 1h, 4h, 1d) are aggregated on-the-fly from 1m data.

BinanceInterval.title: BinanceInterval
BinanceInterval.description:
Candlestick intervals aligned with crypto up/down market timeframes.

- 1s, 1m: high-resolution data from pre-aggregated tables
- 5m, 15m, 1h, 4h, 1d: aggregated on-the-fly from 1m candles

BinanceSymbol.title: BinanceSymbol
BinanceSymbol.description: Supported Binance trading pairs for crypto up/down market backtesting.

timestamp.title: Timestamp
timestamp.description: ISO 8601 UTC timestamp with microsecond precision (e.g. 2026-01-31T12:00:00.123456Z)

BinanceTickData.title: BinanceTickData
BinanceTickData.description:
Single book ticker tick at microsecond granularity.

Sourced from Binance BookTicker stream — best bid/ask with quantities
at the moment of each update. Typically 10-26 updates per second per symbol.

ticks.title: Ticks
ticks.description: Array of tick data points, ordered by timestamp ASC

BinanceTicksResponse.title: BinanceTicksResponse
BinanceTicksResponse.description:
Paginated response of raw book ticker data.

Use cursor-based pagination to iterate through large time windows.
A 15-minute window typically contains ~63K ticks per symbol.

SmartActivitySortBy.title: SmartActivitySortBy
SmartActivitySortBy.description: Sort options for smart activity markets.

smart_wallet_count.title: Smart Wallet Count
smart_wallet_count.description: Number of smart wallets in this market

net_buyers.title: Net Buyers
net_buyers.description: Smart wallets that are net buyers (buy_volume > sell_volume)

net_sellers.title: Net Sellers
net_sellers.description: Smart wallets that are net sellers

net_buyers_pct.title: Net Buyers Pct
net_buyers_pct.description: Percentage of smart wallets that are net buyers (0-1)

total_smart_buy_volume.title: Total Smart Buy Volume
total_smart_buy_volume.description: Total buy volume from smart wallets (USD)

total_smart_sell_volume.title: Total Smart Sell Volume
total_smart_sell_volume.description: Total sell volume from smart wallets (USD)

avg_smart_buy_price.title: Avg Smart Buy Price
avg_smart_buy_price.description: Volume-weighted average buy price of smart wallets (0-1)

avg_smart_sell_price.title: Avg Smart Sell Price
avg_smart_sell_price.description: Volume-weighted average sell price of smart wallets (0-1)

avg_smart_win_rate.title: Avg Smart Win Rate
avg_smart_win_rate.description: Average win rate of smart wallets

SmartMoneyPositioning.title: SmartMoneyPositioning
SmartMoneyPositioning.description: Aggregate smart money positioning for a market.

smart_wallet_criteria.title: Smart Wallet Criteria
smart_wallet_criteria.description: Criteria used to define smart wallets

SmartMoneyResponse.title: SmartMoneyResponse
SmartMoneyResponse.description: Response for smart money positioning endpoint.

order_hash.title: Order Hash
order_hash.description: Order hash (same order can have multiple fills)

is_yes_side.title: Is Yes Side
is_yes_side.description: True if trade is for YES token, False for NO token

timestamp.title: Timestamp
timestamp.description: Unix timestamp in seconds (start of period)

total_volume.title: Total Volume
total_volume.description: Total USD volume in this period

yes_volume.title: Yes Volume
yes_volume.description: YES-side USD volume in this period

no_volume.title: No Volume
no_volume.description: NO-side USD volume in this period

trades_count.title: Trades Count
trades_count.description: Number of trades in this period

start_time.title: Start Time
start_time.description: Unix timestamp of first data point

end_time.title: End Time
end_time.description: Unix timestamp of last data point

volume.title: Volume
volume.description: Cumulative volume up to this point

buy_volume.title: Buy Volume
buy_volume.description: Cumulative buy volume up to this point

sell_volume.title: Sell Volume
sell_volume.description: Cumulative sell volume up to this point

metrics.description: Combined metrics across specified markets (aggregated from per-market data)

entry_edge.title: Entry Edge
entry_edge.description: Combined price edge across specified markets (avg_sell - avg_buy)

markets_matched.title: Markets Matched
markets_matched.description: Number of specified markets this wallet traded

WalletFilterEntry.title: WalletFilterEntry
WalletFilterEntry.description: Single entry in wallet filter results.

markets.title: Markets
markets.description: Market condition IDs used in filter

WalletFilterResponse.title: WalletFilterResponse
WalletFilterResponse.description: Response for wallet filter by markets endpoint.

first_trade_at.title: First Trade At
first_trade_at.description: First trade timestamp in this market

last_trade_at.title: Last Trade At
last_trade_at.description: Last trade timestamp in this market

WalletMetrics.title: WalletMetrics
WalletMetrics.description: All metrics for a wallet across all time windows.

unrealized_pnl.title: Unrealized Pnl
unrealized_pnl.description: Current unrealized PnL (USD), computed live from positions

computed_at.title: Computed At
computed_at.description: Unix timestamp when metrics were computed

target_wallet.title: Target Wallet
target_wallet.description: The wallet we're finding similar wallets for

target_market_count.title: Target Market Count
target_market_count.description: Number of markets the target wallet has traded

WindowMetrics.title: WindowMetrics
WindowMetrics.description: Metrics for a specific time window.
